Hey, this following error is shown in the driver station. There is comms but no robot code:

Error: Exception thrown by the agent : java.net.MalformedURLException: Unable to resolve hostname or get valid IP address Ôªø

This happened really randomly after we finished working on the robot and deploying code to it.

Im not experienced enough to know exactly what‚Äôs wrong but I can provide some tips

Is your team number set on your rio, and ds?

Is your rio actually connected to your radio?

Check recent code changes for anything abnormal? Maybe changes in gradle?

If the robot has code on it, does it behave as expected? ‚Üê could help find the issue

Can you see your rio in the imaging utility if you plug into it with a printer cable?

Are your rio status lights normal, and radio?

Is your rio getting enough power? (Could be undervolting or something)

Try a different ethernet cable?

Try deploying old code to see if that fixes it

Reflash your rio if you can

Try an old rio?

These are just general troubleshooting tips but hopefully they help

Edit: forgot to mention but the stacktrace is (as far as i know) saying that it cant find the address of your rio, usually 10.TE.AM.2 or similar, meaning it could not exist or your team number could be wrong, etc.

Try plugging an ethernet cable into your robot and deploying the code like that. If that makes it work, then there is something wrong with the wireless connection via radio. If it doesn‚Äôt work, it means that there could be an error with the team number or something in the code is making it misbehave.

This happens when you connect with Ethernet? Does wireless connectivity work? Did you make sure that your team number in the roborio, driver station, and vscode all match?
